landing.bio: I am a fresh graduate of Portland State University's Bachelor of Computer Science program as of March, 21st, 2020. Now I am actively seeking employment in accessibility, site reliability engineering, full stack engineering, or related information technology fields with a team that will appreciate my flexibility, adaptability and upbeat attitude.

experience.organization: Universal Design Lab - Portland State University
experience.aboutWork: The Universal Design Lab received a grant from the federal government to design and build a braille teaching mobile application with the help of a local firm. My job is to improve and maintain the React Native mobile braille teaching app, React single page web application for the mobile app's content creation and AWS hosted webserver.

My work on my capstone team was focused on the website, or Presentation, portion of this project. We used the javascript framework Mithril with Bootstrap and custom CSS to make the fronted, Node and Express to make the API server and connected all of this with the Restoration team's MySQL database using docker containers.

education.degree: Associates of Arts Oregon Regional Transfer

interests.paragraphOne: I appreciate Oregon's vast access to the great outdoors. I use every opportunity to get out into the backcountry for hiking and backpacking. I am also a hobby mechanic with a special place in my heart for aging Japanese Motorcycles and Cars. I enjoy driving these projects on the wonderful back roads of Oregon.
interests.paragraphTwo: When I am not outside I like to cook for my friends and family using the skills I learned as an izakaya saut√© chef. I also like fixing things around the house, playing video games and tinkering with personal projects that expand my skills as a programmer.
